message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest generalized anxiety disorder, which can be managed with medications like Buspirone. Bupropion is not the first-line treatment for anxiety. Desensitization therapy and relaxation training may be helpful but are not as effective as medication for managing symptoms of generalized anxiety disorder.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest anxiety disorder, and among the options, Buspirone is most effective for treating anxiety disorder. Bupropion is used to treat depression and possibly for smoking cessation. Desensitization therapy and relaxation training are behavioral therapies that can be helpful, but may not be the most effective initial treatment for this patient.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest generalized anxiety disorder (GAD). Buspirone is an anxiolytic that is effective in treating GAD. Bupropion is an antidepressant and not specifically indicated for anxiety. Desensitization therapy and relaxation training may be helpful as adjuncts but are not the primary treatment for GAD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing anxiety and difficulty sleeping, which are common symptoms of generalized anxiety disorder. Buspirone is an effective treatment for this condition because it is a serotonin receptor agonist that can reduce anxiety and improve sleep. Bupropion is an antidepressant that is not effective for anxiety disorders, and desensitization therapy and relaxation training may be helpful as adjunctive therapies, but are not effective in treating the underlying condition.
